headers.full: The Additive and Multiplicative Structure of the Real Numbers System
headers.toc: The Additive and Multiplicative Structure of the Real Numbers System

intro.para: In this section we discuss structural axioms describing addition and multiplication of real numbers: these are the structural axioms of a field. We then derive some consequences of these axioms.

def.caption: Field structure of real numbers

info.caption: Comment on the field axioms of \RNr
info.para: For simplicity we have permitted some redundancy in the axioms stated below. For example, it is enough to require of the number 0 that a+0 = a for all a\in \RNr. The identity 0 + a = 0 follows then with the commutativity axiom.

section.body.para: We will now derive some consequences of these axioms. One immediate concern arises from the existence axiom for an element which is neutral with respect to addition, from the existence axiom for additive inverses and, similarly, from their multiplicative inverses. In each case, if there is one such element, there could be many. The following lemmas assert that these elements are unique.
